translation: Yesterday, I asked my son, “Who do you like most? Who would you like to become?”
transcript: 昨天呢，我问我的儿子，我说：“你最喜欢谁？最想成为谁？”

translation: He answered, “I’d like to be Prof. Do most. ”
transcript: 他告诉我：“我最想成为都教授。”

translation: I asked, “Why?”
transcript: 我说：“为什么？”

translation: He said, “Because he impresses and influences mum.”
transcript: 他说：“因为他影响妈妈。”

translation: Actually, deep inside, many of us wish to be someone else.
transcript: 其实我们很多人都有一种想法，想成为谁。

translation: Someone like the US president, who has the power to influence others.
transcript: 比方说成为美国总统，他能够通过权力影响别人。

translation: Right?
transcript: 你说对吗？

translation: Who else?
transcript: 还有一些人想成为谁呢？

translation: Maybe Li Ka-shing, who’s wealthy enough to influence others.
transcript: 李嘉诚，因为他有钱，他也能影响别人。

translation: But you know what?
transcript: 但是你知道吗？

translation: I’m not even close to Prof. Du.
transcript: 我连都教授都不是。

translation: Look at me.
transcript: 我长成这个样子。

translation: Qin often jokes I’m like a wise buddha.
transcript: 我们秦老师说我聪明绝顶。

translation: Well, I’m almost as baldheaded as a buddha. That’s for sure.
transcript: 我头发确实不多。

translation: For those of us without much money, power and wisdom, how can we impress and influence others?
transcript: 那么我们又没有钱，又没有权，也不是都教授，怎么影响别人呢？

translation: Let me tell you a story of my pupil.
transcript: 下面请听一个我徒弟的故事。

translation: One day, when I was talking business with others via QQ, I suddenly received a message from a stranger, “Are you Mr. Li Ligang?”
transcript: 有一天呢我在QQ上面正好在工作，跟别人说点事情，突然有个人加我了，说：“你是李力刚老师吗？”

translation: And I replied, “Yes, I am.”
transcript: 我说：“是。”

translation: “What’s up?”
transcript: 我说：“你找我有什么事？”

translation: He said, “I bought your book, on which there’s your QQ account. I just want to check out if it’s really yours.”
transcript: 他说：“我买了你一本书，上面有你的QQ号，我想确认一下你是不是本人。”

translation: I said, “Yes, it’s mine.”
transcript: 我说：“我是。”

translation: We continued to chat for about half an hour.
transcript: 跟我聊了半个小时以后。

translation: He then asked, “Mr. Li, can you do me a favor?”
transcript: 他跟我说了一句话，他说：“李老师，能跟你提个要求吗？”

translation: I said, “Go ahead.”
transcript: 我说：“你讲。”

translation: “Can you please give me some of your books that you no longer need?”
transcript: “能不能把你平时不看的一些书送给我？”

translation: I asked, “Why?”
transcript: 我说：“为什么？”

translation: He said, “I am too poor to afford more books. Would you like to help the poor?”
transcript: 他说：“因为我们家里边很穷，我买不起书，你愿意帮助没有钱的人吗？”

translation: I realized that I was in no position to say NO.
transcript: 我发现，如果我说NO，我就连人都不是啦。

translation: So I replied, “Well, OK. Next time when I go to Chongqing, I’ll take some books to you.”
transcript: 我说，：“好吧，我去重庆的时候我带给你。”

translation: He was in Chongqing.
transcript: 他在重庆。

translation: It turned out that when I went to Chongqing, I forgot to do so.
transcript: 结果我去重庆的时候呢，我忘记给他带了。

translation: To keep my word, I bought him five books at the airport, which cost me RMB 127 in total. I remember it very clearly because I’m a very stingy person.
transcript: 为了遵守我的承诺，所以呢，我在机场就给他买了五本书，我记得很清楚，因为我是小气的人，花了127块钱。

translation: He asked, “Mr. Li. Where will you deliver your speech tomorrow?”
transcript: 他说：“李老师，明天你在什么地方演讲？”

translation: I said, “Chongqing Jinzi Hotel.”
transcript: 我说：“我在重庆金字酒店。”

translation: He asked, “Can I come?”
transcript: 他说：“我可以来吗？”

translation: I said, “There’s an admission fee of RMB 1,800 per person, according to the organizer.”
transcript: 我说：“可能主办方要求你交1800块钱。”

translation: He said, “Mr. Li, you know I can’t afford it. Can I pretend to be your assistant? I know you are always such a nice person.”
transcript: 他说：“李老师我没有钱啊！你跟别人说，我是你的助理好吗？李老师我知道你向来喜欢帮助人。”

translation: The next day he did come, without paying a cent.
transcript: 第二天他就来了，你知道吗，一分钱都没给。

translation: When I finished my one and half an hour’s speech, he came to see me at the backstage.
transcript: 然后呢，当我讲了一个半小时休息的时候，他来后台找我。

translation: He said, “Hello, Mr. Li. I’m Xie.”
transcript: 他说：“李老师我就是小谢。”

translation: I said, “Nice to meet you!”
transcript: 我说：“你好。”

translation: Then he surprised me by suddenly genuflecting to me, asking “Will Mr. Li please take me as your pupil?”
transcript: 突然之间他干了一件事情让我很惊讶，他半跪在地上说：“李老师，我能拜你做老师吗？”

translation: I asked, “Why?”
transcript: 我说：“为什么？”

translation: He said, “Because I like the ideas you talked about.”
transcript: 他说：“我很喜欢你的内容。”

translation: I said, “Sorry, I cannot because I’m unworthy of being your teacher.”
transcript: 我说：“很抱歉我无德无能，我不能收你。”

translation: He insisted, “I will not stand up until you say Yes.”
transcript: 他说：“李老师你不收我，我就不站起来。”

translation: Then I said, “Stand up first and we talk.”
transcript: 后来我说：“你站起来再说。”

translation: He thus stood up and said, “Mr. Li, you can call me Bajie and I’ll address you as master.”
transcript: 他站起来之后，他说：“李老师，以后你可以叫我叫八戒，我叫你师父。”

translation: Since then, he stopped calling me Mr. Li.
transcript: 从此以后，无论我怎么样说话，他从此再也不叫我李老师。

translation: What does he call me?
transcript: 叫什么？

translation: Do you know?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: He thought we were in a master-pupil relationship from then on.
transcript: 就因为自从成了师父以后，他就把我收了。

translation: He said, “Master, I’m gonna graduate next year. Have you got any client enterprise in Chongqing?”
transcript: 他跟我说：“李老师，我明年就要毕业了，请问你跟重庆的哪些企业服务过吗？”

translation: I said, “Yes.”
transcript: 我说：“服务过。”

translation: “Can you send my resume to that auto company?”
transcript: “麻烦你把我把简历递给那家汽车公司好吗？”

translation: You know what?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: I felt like he’s the boss and I became his first employee.
transcript: 我成了他的第一个员工。

translation: He didn’t find any job via my connections.
transcript: 后来他可能通过我的关系并没有找到工作。

translation: But in a similar way, he got a sales job at an auto company.
transcript: 但是他也许用同样的方式，他真的进了一家汽车公司卖汽车。

translation: Again he asked, “Master. Can you teach me how to become a champion?”
transcript: 他又跟我说：“师父，你能帮助我如何才能成为冠军吗？”

translation: We thus talked about everything that mattered to becoming a champion.
transcript: 后来我们就一直聊关于冠军的话题。

translation: Four months later, he suddenly contacted me via WeChat, “Master. I’m a champion now.”
transcript: 突然在四个月之后，他在微信上给我说了一句：“师父，我终于成为冠军了。”

translation: I said, “Congrats.”
transcript: 我说：“祝贺你。”

translation: He said, “Your idea does work.”
transcript: 他说：“你的东西挺实用的。”

translation: I replied, “Thanks!”
transcript: 我说：“感谢你”！

translation: I literally thanked him.
transcript: 我要说感谢他啊！

translation: You know what?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: He later updated his QQ status with “I’ll do something big next year.”
transcript: 他后来在QQ签名上写了一句，明年我要干一件大事。

translation: I asked, “What is the big thing according to your definition?”
transcript: 我说：“你要干一件什么大事？”

translation: He refused to tell me and said, “You will see next year.”
transcript: 他给我埋了个地雷说：“师父明年你就知道了。”

translation: One year later, I asked him via QQ, “Can you unveil the answer now?”
transcript: 到了第二年的时候呢，我就QQ上问他，我说：“徒弟，你到底想干一件什么事情？”

translation: He said, “Yes, Master. I’m running my own business now. I’m the general manager and my elder sister’s my vice general manager. I’m just 21, though.”
transcript: 他说：“师父，我给你汇报一下，我现在出来创业了，我姐姐做副总经理，我做总经理，尽管我才21岁。”

translation: This lad has deeply impressed me.
transcript: 这个小伙子呢深深地影响了我。

translation: You know what?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: There’s something more.
transcript: 还有一件更大的事情。

translation: One day, I received a cylinder-shaped gift from him. It’s about this long.
transcript: 他有天给我寄了一个非常圆筒状的这么长的东西。

translation: The moment I opened the package, I knew why he could impress me.
transcript: 打开了一看我知道他收服我是有道理的。

translation: His gift was something like a silk banner for heroic police.
transcript: 因为他寄了一个就是像送给那个警察叔叔那种锦旗一样送给我。

translation: I kept asking myself why Xie impressed me so much.
transcript: 我后来想了很久，小谢为什么能够影响我呢？

translation: I could think of nothing more than the word “giving”.
transcript: 其实想来想去没有别的东西就只有一个字，就叫“给”。

translation: The purpose of giving is to satisfy certain need of an individual.
transcript: 因为给，是因为我们每个人都要。

translation: When you need something, you ask for it.
transcript: 当要的时候。

translation: Just like in order to eat, you have to open your mouth first.
transcript: 正如你吃饭的时候一样，你必须打开嘴巴。

translation: Right?
transcript: 你同意吗？

translation: Is there anyone who can have a meal without opening your mouth? If so, please hands up.
transcript: 凡是不打开嘴巴吃饭的请举个手。

translation: I don’t think there’s any.
transcript: 我看没有。

translation: Also, when you want to hear something, you have to use your ears.
transcript: 就正如你想听东西的时候一样，必须把耳朵张开也是一样的。

translation: Likewise, when you want to impress or influence others, the best way is to give.
transcript: 所以，当我们想影响别人的时候，其实真正的好的方法就是给。

translation: I used to think the Cantonese worldly and vulgar.
transcript: 最开始我觉得广东人很庸俗。

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么呢？

translation: Because whenever they meet someone, they invariably greet “Hello, Mr. Handsome or Miss. Beautiful”.
transcript: 因为他们见面就说靓仔靓妹，见面就拍马屁。

translation: For me then, flattering at the first sight was too much.
transcript: 实在是让我觉得受不了。

translation: But I gradually changed my view, considering the Cantonese’s greeting not vulgar but smart.
transcript: 但是后来我就觉得广东人不是庸俗，他是厉害啊！

translation: Why?
transcript: 为什么厉害呢？

translation: Because Guangdong was the pioneer of China’s Reform and Opening-up.
transcript: 因为广东最先改革开放。

translation: The Cantonese thus had the opportunity to meet various outlanders, who wanted to make friends and do business with them.
transcript: 大量见到了外地的陌生人，想跟他们交朋友或者做生意。

translation: It’s of course better for them to be nice to those strangers.
transcript: 应该先拉近距离还是拉开距离？我相信应该是拉近。

translation: To make friends, it’s better to give than to receive.
transcript: 拉近的方法是给还是拿呢？我相信是给。

translation: What can we give?
transcript: 给什么呢？

translation: Which do you prefer to give?
transcript: 我相信让你做个选择？

translation: Respect or benefit?
transcript: 是给名还是给利？

translation: You don’t care as long as it costs you no money.
transcript: 你的选择是只要不花钱。

translation: To sum up, we cannot expect anything from those who’re unwilling to give their respect.
transcript: 所以我们总结一句话，连名都不肯给的人，还肯给点啥？

translation: Similarly, we cannot expect anything from those who’re unwilling to give their big hand.
transcript: 就类似于说连掌声都不肯给的人，还肯给点啥呢？

translation: Speaking of giving, what exactly should we give to others?
transcript: 那么我们讲到给，到底给什么东西呢？

translation: Perhaps the answer varies from person to person.
transcript: 我们看有不同段位的人，也许有不同的方法。

translation: Let’s see the answer from man of top marketing wisdom.
transcript: 那么第一等高手，他给什么东西呢？

translation: As we see, man of top wisdom chooses to give benefit.
transcript: 我们请看一下，第一等高手其实给的是利。

translation: Once when I was on my way to airport in Shanghai, I received a phone call and was attracted by a girl’s voice.
transcript: 你会发现当我去上海的机场办票的时候，一个姑娘的声音在电话里边吸引了我。

translation: She said, “Hello, Mr. Li. This is the credit card service of XXX bank.”
transcript: “李先生，你好，我是某某银行信用卡中心。”

translation: I immediately said, “No, thanks.”
transcript: 我的第一句话就是不要。

translation: She continued, “Sir, it’s OK whether you need our card or not. The thing is, I’d like to give you a little gift. Will you take it? ”
transcript: 她说：“先生，您办不办信用卡无所谓，关键我要送你一些东西，你要吗？”

translation: How could I hang it up?
transcript: 这个电话我挂不下去？

translation: So I asked, “What gift?”
transcript: 我问了一句：“什么东西？”

translation: She said, “We’ll give you one free tooth-wash service per year. Will you take it?”
transcript: 她说：“我们决定一年免费让你洗一次牙，送给你，你要不要？”

translation: I said, “Yes, I’d like to.”
transcript: 我说：“这个可以要。”

translation: And I added, “Anything else?”
transcript: 我说：“还能送什么？”

translation: She said, “What about 12 rounds of golf for free?”
transcript: 她说：“再决定免费送你一年免费打12次高尔夫球，你要不要？”

translation: I said yes.
transcript: 我这个也可以要啊。

translation: I asked again, “Anything else?”
transcript: 我又反问了一句：“还能送给我什么？”

translation: She said, “We can give you one-year free service. What service do you need?”
transcript: 她说先生：“我们还决定一年免费，哦你要什么？”

translation: I asked, “Can you give me one-year free access to your airport VIP lounge?”
transcript: 我说：“你能免费让我进你们的机场贵宾厅吗？”

translation: She said, “Sure.”
transcript: 她说：“可以。”

translation: Then I said, “Deal! Please come to see me at my office on August 29.”
transcript: 我说：“现在不要再说了，请8月29号到我的办公室来找我。”

translation: You know what?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: She didn’t show up on August 29, which was to my surprise.
transcript: 8月29号她亲自都没有过来，我以为她会来。

translation: Instead, she sent an intern to my office and asked, “Are you Mr. Li?”
transcript: 她派了一个大学实习生冲进我的办公室，说：“你是李先生吗？”

translation: I said yes.
transcript: 我说：“是。”

translation: “Please show me your ID card and property ownership certificate,” said she.
transcript: “请把身份证和房产证明给我。”

translation: Immediately after that, she began to process my application.
transcript: 就直接进入成交环节了。

translation: Her presence made it impossible for me to say no.
transcript: 后来我想，我都把别人薅过来了，不办也不好意思。

translation: So I applied for one credit card and thought it’s up to me whether to use it or not.
transcript: 后来我就办了一张，我想反正我不开卡就算了。

translation: It turned out that they promised to give fivefold points if I activated the card within designated days.
transcript: 结果他们又说在几天之内开卡又可以算5倍积分。

translation: Thus I did so and they fulfilled their promise.
transcript: 我就开了，他们又给了。

translation: You know what?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: I am a holder of China Eastern’s gold card. But the other day, I was at the Beijing International Airport, waiting for a flight not provided by it.
transcript: 去了北京的机场，我那天正好没有坐东航，我的金卡的航空公司。

translation: I approached their staff and asked, “Where is the VIP lounge of XXX Bank at T3?”
transcript: 我就去找问她们服务员，“请问T3航站楼的某某银行的贵宾厅在哪里？”

translation: A lady answered me gently, “Sir, please follow me.”
transcript: 那个服务小姐很温柔地对我说“先生请跟我来。”

translation: I followed her down to the 2nd floor.
transcript: 你知道吗，我就跟她下了二楼。

translation: She led the way like a maid, while I was like Empress Zhenhuan.
transcript: 我发现她像宫女一样走在前面，我则像甄嬛。

translation: You know how I felt.
transcript: 走在后面这种感觉只有一个字，你懂的。

translation: I suddenly understood why they gave me benefits for free.
transcript: 就因为别人给了我免费的利，所以我明白了。

translation: They’d say, “It doesn’t matter if you buy the beer or not. Just have a drink.”
transcript: 先生，啤酒买不买无所谓，先什么一下，尝一下。

translation: They’d say, “It doesn’t matter if you buy the grape or not. Just have a taste.”
transcript: 葡萄买不买无所谓，先什么一下，先吃一下。

translation: They’d say, “It doesn’t matter if you buy this car or not. Just have a drive.”
transcript: 说，车买不买无所谓，先驾一下。

translation: The other time, a lad even joked, “It doesn’t matter if you marry me or not…”
transcript: 上次有个男孩子更狠，说找不找我做老公也是无所谓的。

translation: So, the answer from man of top marketing wisdom is “to give benefit”.
transcript: 但是呢这个是我们讲的一段高手给的是利。

translation: What’s the answer from man of second highest wisdom?
transcript: 那么二段高手给什么呢？

translation: It is “to give respect.”
transcript: 给的是名。

translation: To give respect means to make others feel good about themselves.
transcript: 给名是给别人精神享受。

translation: That’s why the Cantonese call strangers Mr. Handsome and Mr. Beautiful.
transcript: 正如广东人说靓仔靓妹是一样的。

translation: Can you imagine a guy should go after a girl by telling her like this?
transcript: 你会发现有没有男孩子这样追女朋友的？

translation: “Hey, an ugly girl like you should feel flattered to have my affection and see a movie with me.”
transcript: 说，姑娘，你去买张电影票，像你长得这么丑的人，我来追追你好吗？

translation: No one does that.
transcript: 没有这样的人。

translation: As you can see today, many people, regardless of occasions, are afraid of talking with the rich, the powerful or the elderly.
transcript: 今天你会发现有很多人，无论在什么场合，怕跟有钱人、有权的人、年龄大的人聊天。

translation: And they are particularly afraid of being nobody, neither having president’s power nor Li Ka-shing’s fortune.
transcript: 尤其怕自己什么都不是，也不是总统，也不是李嘉诚；又没有权，又没有钱。

translation: How can a new graduate possibly impress and influence the senior management?
transcript: 普通人刚刚毕业的人，如何去影响高层呢？

translation: Please hands up if you have any idea.
transcript: 如果你有兴趣你举个手。

translation: You know what?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: All through the years, the question has tormented me.
transcript: 这么多年以来，我也感到蛮痛苦。

translation: Fortunately, I find the answer now.
transcript: 好在我今天终于把答案找到了。

translation: Do you want to hear my answer?
transcript: 你想听吗？

translation: What should you give?
transcript: 你应该给什么呢？

translation: You know what?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: I was once in a nightclub, participating in a dealers’ meeting.
transcript: 当我在夜总会里边，夜总会是因为他们搞经销商大会，我在参与。

translation: I was seated beside a board chairman, not knowing what to say.
transcript: 后来呢我被安排在一位董事长面前坐在一起，我们两个人真的见面就没话说。

translation: He’s a chairman, while I’m a teacher.
transcript: 他是董事长我是老师。

translation: He said, “Hey, Mr. Li. Please feel free to talk.”
transcript: 他就说：“李老师，随便啊！”

translation: I said, “OK.”
transcript: 我说：“嗯嗯。”

translation: “Just feel free to talk！”
transcript: “李老师随便啊！”

translation: I said, “OK.”
transcript: 我说：“嗯嗯。”

translation: For half an hour, we did nothing but repeat this nonsense.
transcript: 我们半个小时就干这个事情。

translation: Although I felt so boring, I just couldn’t find a topic to break the silence.
transcript: 后来我实在觉得很无聊，我不知道该跟他聊什么，我不知道。

translation: Later, I gradually improved my chat skill at work.
transcript: 好在我在工作的时候学会了一门技巧。

translation: My secret lies in giving others’ respect.
transcript: 就是给名的方法。

translation: In other words, flattering them.
transcript: 就叫天下第一拍，拍什么呢？拍马屁。

translation: How?
transcript: 什么拍呢？

translation: Right now, we are preparing an interview at the backstage.
transcript: 我们的后台呢现在正在进行采访。

translation: Whom are we going to interview?
transcript: 采访谁呢？

translation: Tang Jun.
transcript: 待会儿的演讲嘉宾叫唐骏。

translation: All presenters know how to flatter an interviewee with a right question.
transcript: 所有的主持人都明白一个道理，什么叫天下第一拍，问所有的高手什么问题。

translation: Today, I want to ask you a question.
transcript: 今天我想问你一下。

translation: Should a hero be silent about his past glories?
transcript: 好汉提当年勇吗？

translation: Do you feel free to deliver an acceptance speech?
transcript: 你喜欢发表获奖感言吗？

translation: Is the old saying that “a hero should be silent about his past glories” a warning or a conclusion?
transcript: 好汉不提当年勇是告诫好汉的还是总结好汉的？

translation: It is a warning, for hardly any hero can resist the temptation of talking about his past glories.
transcript: 是告诫，没有好汉不提当年勇。

translation: So, all presenters, including Li Yong, Li Jing, Dai Jun, Yang Lan and Chen Luyu would do so.
transcript: 所以，所有主持人包括李咏、李静、戴军，什么这个杨澜、鲁豫，她们都这么干的。

translation: For example, when they interviewed comedian Tang Jiezhong, they’d ask, “Mr.Tang, can you summarize your pursuit of art all through the journey in one sentence?”
transcript: 比方说采访唐杰忠老师，她们就会问一句经典的话，说：“唐老师，干了这么多年的艺术，请问一路走来最想说的一句话是什么？”

translation: This seemingly plain question flattered the interviewee most.
transcript: 觉得一点马屁的声音都没有，但听来其实就是一个最凶猛的马屁。

translation: That’s the highest state of flattering.
transcript: 叫天下第一拍。

translation: We later jokingly concluded their little trick as “all through the journey”.
transcript: 后来我们把它浓缩成为只有四个字，就叫一路走来。

translation: So when I couldn’t find a proper topic to share with the board chairman beside me, I decided to try the presenters’ trick.
transcript: 当我跟那位董事长坐在夜总会里面实在是无话可说的时候，我就开始了。

translation: I said, “Chairman Quan, you have accumulated RMB 200m assets within three years. What an extraordinary achievement! Can you summarize your understanding all through the journey in one sentence?”
transcript: 我说：“权董事长短短三年时间做到两亿资产不容易呀！请问一路走你最想说的一句话是什么？”

translation: To my surprise, he was even more hypocritical than I was.
transcript: 没想到啊没想到，他的人格比我都还要分裂一点。

translation: He replied, “Hahaha, Mr. Li, you are an expert in this regard. You tell me.”
transcript: 他说，“哈哈哈，李老师你是专家，我还准备请教你呢。”

translation: Even so, I gradually discovered that when I failed to impress him with one compliment, I just needed to keep trying others until he bought it.
transcript: 但是我后来发现，挠一个地方，他不痒，我就换个地方挠，我挠了他好多地方他就hold不住了。

translation: After over one hour’s chatting, I believed he was flattered.
transcript: 后来聊了一个多小时以后，我相信他心中只有一个字，你懂的。

translation: Another time a relative of mine talked with me.
transcript: 还有一次呢，我们我们家的亲戚跟我聊天。

translation: He was then 59 and I was only 31.
transcript: 他59岁而我只有31岁。

translation: In the noon of the second day of the Chinese New Year, my relatives proposed to play mah-jong.
transcript: 大年初二的中午说打麻将。

translation: As a Sichuaner, I love playing mah-jong.
transcript: 我作为四川人我还是比较喜欢的。

translation: But I hate to be encircled by a gang of women, including my wife.
transcript: 但是很讨厌的是，一帮女人们就把它们围满了，其中就包括我的老婆。

translation: I thus said to that senior relative, “Shall we have a chat instead?”
transcript: 于是我跟我这位长辈亲戚说：“我们去聊聊天好吗？”

translation: He said, “Good idea. What can we talk about?”
transcript: 他说：“好啊，小李，你说聊什么呢？”

translation: See? You can imagine how I felt.
transcript: 你懂的。

translation: I said, “As a veteran in your industry, can you share with me your experience and understanding all through the journey?”
transcript: 我说：“长长辈你你在这个行业做了这么多年，一路走来有些什么经验和心得能不能帮我分享一下。”

translation: You know what?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: He fell for flattery easily.
transcript: 他一点都hold不住啊。

translation: He said, “Ok. You may be an expert in your consulting industry, but not in mine. I’d like to share with you my working experience.”
transcript: 他说：“小李，你们这个这个做做咨询的人有咨询的道理，我们做这一行的也有我们的道理，那我跟你讲点这个行业的道理好吗？”

translation: I recalled my previous boss often asked me to take notes when listening to a “big fish”.
transcript: 以前我的老板告诉我，只要别人跟你讲话的时候，只要高手跟你讲话的时候，立马拿个本儿和笔出来。

translation: So I asked, “Uncle, have you got any paper?”
transcript: 我说：“长辈，有纸吗？”

translation: His son brought me a pen and paper.
transcript: 后来他的儿子给我拿了纸和笔以后。

translation: Then I took notes while he was talking.
transcript: 他一边聊我就一边记。

translation: One hour later, he said, “Li, the living room is so cold. Let’s go into the air-conditioned bedroom and continue.”
transcript: 聊了一个多小时他说：“小李，客厅里面暖气不足，我们去卧室打空调。”

translation: There, we had another one-hour’s talk.
transcript: 后来去了卧室里面聊了又聊了将近一个小时。

translation: I asked, “Uncle, can I get more paper?”
transcript: 我说：“长辈，还有纸吗？”

translation: He was a good speaker.
transcript: 他聊得真的很经典。

translation: Seriously. I took all his brilliant ideas down.
transcript: 我全部记下来了。

translation: His words did benefit me a lot.
transcript: 我获益匪浅。

translation: I did not pretend to be modest.
transcript: 我并没有要故意要什么样的意思。

translation: You know what?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: Four hours later, his wife couldn’t stand it anymore.
transcript: 我们聊了四个多小时的时候就把他的太太聊崩溃了。

translation: She told us the dinner was ready for a couple of times. After all, it’s the second day of Chinese New Year.
transcript: 因为她们大年初二热好晚饭叫了我们两三次吃饭。

translation: But neither of us replied her.
transcript: 我们都稳坐钓鱼台不动。

translation: She grew angry, “If you don’t want it, I will dump it.”
transcript: 她就生气地说：“吃不吃啊，不吃我倒了啊。”

translation: Hearing that, my uncle said, “Li, let’s have dinner first, or else she won’t give us a break.”
transcript: 后来我这位长辈说：“小李，咱俩别挨骂，咱们先吃饭去。”

translation: After dinner, he said, “Li, I still have something to share.”
transcript: 吃完饭我这位长辈说：“小李，还有一段儿没跟你说完。”

translation: That’s what we call “feel like old friends at the first meeting”.
transcript: 今天你理解什么叫一见如故了吗？

translation: Essentially, “a house on fire” occurs when you meet a “big fish” and you two immediately establish a rapport.
transcript: 一见如故的核心标准，如果你碰到高人，首先是把别人聊高兴了还是把你聊高兴了。

translation: You know.
transcript: 你懂的。

translation: You’re not supposed to stop the other high-spirited one talking, however you want to deep inside.
transcript: 哪怕把别人聊到了口沫横飞滔滔不绝喷了你满脸口水，你还是要忍住，哪怕这个时候早就内出血。

translation: This is how man of second highest wisdom do, this is, giving respect.
transcript: 这是我们讲的第二个，叫给名的方式。

translation: How can you expect anything from those who’re unwilling to give their respect?
transcript: 您知道吗，连名都不肯给的人，还肯给点啥？

translation: When you can’t afford to give your employees bonus, give them more certificates of merit at least.
transcript: 当不能给员工发奖金的时候，多搞两张奖状吧！

translation: That’s probably how your boss did.
transcript: 你的老板可能就是这么干的。

translation: Anyway, profit comes first, respect second.
transcript: 你要了解当我们第一是给利，第二是给名。

translation: What’s third?
transcript: 那么第三段的高手又给什么东西呢？

translation: Man of the third highest wisdom may give “approach”.
transcript: 其实第三段高手给的可能是一个字叫法。

translation: In a Buddhist context, profit-giving corresponds to “property-giving”; respect-giving corresponds to “confidence-boosting”; “approach-giving” corresponds to “method-teaching”, i.e. showing others the way to target fulfillment.
transcript: 如果我们把它串在一起，给利、给名和给法，用在佛教里边第一个叫财布施，就财物布施，就是给予；第二个叫无畏布施，给人信心；第三个叫做法布施，也叫真理布施，教给别人目标和实现它的方法是什么。

translation: I asked my kid, “What do you want to do at school?”
transcript: 今天我教我的孩子，我问他：“请问你想在学校里边做什么？”

translation: He said, “I’d like to be a leader of young pioneers.”
transcript: 他说：“我想做大队长。”

translation: His answer inspired me on how to treat my son.
transcript: 所以后来我知道怎么治我儿子了。

translation: Later, whenever he felt aggrieved and began to cry, I would stop him by reminding that “a leader of young pioneers is not supposed to be like that.”
transcript: 他只要一哭的时候我就说：“大队长可不是这个样子的。”

translation: He wiped his tears off and stopped crying.
transcript: 他就抹抹眼泪就不哭了。

translation: You know what?
transcript: 你们知道吗？

translation: Where there’s a will, there’s energy.
transcript: 意志所在，能量即来。

translation: When you believe you are shouldering a certain mission, you’d feel energetic.
transcript: 只要你以为你是什么角色，你就会充满能量。

translation: Do you agree?
transcript: 你同意吗？

translation: This is one objective of the Buddhist “method-teaching”, namely, dreaming.
transcript: 这是叫我们给法布施里边给的目标，也就是梦想。

translation: We need to find a proper approach to realize our dream.
transcript: 第二就是给予的方法，实现梦想的方法。

translation: Years ago, the movie line “What do you think, Yuanfang?” went viral across China.
transcript: 在前两年哪最流行的一句话就是，元芳你怎么看？

translation: I can’t figure out how it became so popular.
transcript: 这句话不知道为什么莫名其妙的火爆。

translation: Its instant fame seemed unexpected and ridiculous.
transcript: 火爆的一点利益一点一点理由，而且连一点征兆都没有。

translation: Let’s assume in the movie, Li Yuanfang’s superior Di Renjie asked him in another way.
transcript: 其实解剖一下，狄大人，此事您怎么看？

translation: Di Renjie could say, “Yuanfang, I think we should first…, then…and then…” Do you think Yuanfang would have any chance to reach his full potential?
transcript: 如果这个时候狄仁杰说，元芳我认为第一该怎么办，第二该怎么办，第三该怎么办，你们会发现以后元芳会有能力吗？

translation: It never occurred to Li Yuanfang.
transcript: 元芳根本没想过。

translation: In that case, who should get the credit if their mission was accomplished? Li Yuanfang or Di Renjie?
transcript: 第二个问题就是即使执行成功了，请问那个成就感是元芳的还是狄仁杰的？

translation: The answer should be Di Renjie, for he contributed the idea and approach.
transcript: 即使成功了也是狄仁杰的，因为是狄大人说该怎么办的。

translation: Do you agree?
transcript: 你同意吧？

translation: How can you expect anything from a boss who’s unwilling to give their staff basic respect?
transcript: 连名都不肯给员工，还能给点啥呢？

translation: That’s why Di Renjie asked in reply, “What do you think, Yuanfang” whenever Li Yuanfang came to ask for his advice.
transcript: 所以，当每次元芳问狄大人此事该怎么办的时候，他就来一句：“元芳，你看怎么办？”

translation: How could such a brilliant guy as Di have no idea at all?
transcript: 因为我在想那么聪明个脑袋的狄大人，他不知道该怎么办吗？

translation: The modern version of Yuanfang would say, “I failed to persuade that salesman. Should I try once more?”
transcript: 后来元芳说：“嘶这次我去搞那个销售他不同意，是不是我再去一次呢？”

translation: Di would say, “Sure! Anything else?”
transcript: 狄大人说：“甚好，还有呢？”

translation: Yuanfang would answer, “I’d better to take someone with me this time. Can I?”
transcript: “我觉得这次我一个人去不行，是不是可以再找个人去呢？”

translation: “Sure! What else?”
transcript: “甚好，还有呢？”

translation: You see?
transcript: 你知道吗？

translation: That’s how a person grows mature step by step under guidance.
transcript: 你的孩子就是这样一步一步被教育成功的。

translation: Do you agree?
transcript: 你同意吗？

translation: Therefore I think influence is essentially about giving.
transcript: 所以我们说，影响力的核心就是给予。

translation: Giving benefit, respect and approach (or rather, method of realizing one’s dream).
transcript: 给予什么呢，给予利、给予名、给予法，就是梦想和他实现梦想的方法。

translation: In addition to top, second and third highest wisdom, there’s also invincible wisdom.
transcript: 那么我们说这是一段高手、二段高手和三段高手，但是这里边还有一个无敌高手，他们是谁呢？

translation: This invincible wisdom belongs to three holy figures.
transcript: 他们是三大高手。

translation: Premier Zhou Enlai used to appeal to the young for “studying hard for the rise of China.”
transcript: 这三大高手，如果周总理说我要为中华之崛起而读书。

translation: This showed his concern for the whole country.
transcript: 已经把中国的人成就完了。

translation: How about Chairman Mao?
transcript: 那毛主席怎么办？

translation: He called for the liberation of all mankind, which was even more ambitious.
transcript: 毛主席说我要解放全人类，我就厉害了。

translation: How about religion?
transcript: 那宗教怎么办呢？

translation: Religions advocate salvation.
transcript: 宗教说那我要普渡众生，于是它说我要普渡众生。

translation: What does that mean?
transcript: 就是说什么意思呢？

translation: What’s next when they have given all respect, benefits and approaches?
transcript: 那就是当我们把名和利、方法都给完了以后，接下来给什么呢？

translation: To put it another way, what if they have nothing more to give?
transcript: 你了解了，那就是如果现在给不了怎么办？

translation: They can give you “future”.
transcript: 我把未来也给你，我把未来都给你了。

translation: Please hands up if you’ve ever been to the Western Paradise.
transcript: 所以，凡是去过西方极乐世界的举个右手。

translation: No one.
transcript: 没有哈。

translation: Please hands up if you’ve ever been to the heaven.
transcript: 去过天堂的也可以举个右手。

translation: No one, either.
transcript: 都没有。

translation: But you know what?
transcript: 但是你知道吗？

translation: Happiness comes to you when you are on your way to your dream.
transcript: 我们说幸福的是走在实现梦想的路上。

translation: When they cannot give you anything more, they promise you a bright future.
transcript: 那么这件事情告诉我们只要现在给不了你，他把未来都给你了。

translation: In this regard, no one can be more excellent than the three holy figures, namely, Jesus Christ, Prophet Muhammad and Buddha Shakyamuni.
transcript: 于是你们知道，这个高手全世界只有3个，他叫耶稣基督，他叫默罕默德，他叫乔达摩悉达多，佛祖。

translation: The three religious figures not only give you “present”, but also “future”.
transcript: 这些人他们不光现在给了你，他们把未来都给了你了。

translation: So they are simply invincible.
transcript: 他们是无敌高手。

translation: The word “give” can be interpreted differently in different contexts.
transcript: 所以我们说关于“给”有几种说法。

translation: According to Christianity, to give is to love.
transcript: 如果用一个字叫爱，是基督教说的。

translation: Other religions may associate “giving” with “positive energy” and “divine intervention or salvation”.
transcript: 如果用两个字叫给予，如果叫三个字叫正能量，四个字叫普渡众生。

translation: In Chairman Mao’s words, to give means to serve the people.
transcript: 五个字就是毛主席说的为人民服务。

translation: Thanks to such great figures, the whole world becomes more and more faithful, more peaceful and happier.
transcript: 正因为有这样的高人存在，所以全世界变得越来越有信仰，变得越来越安静，越来越幸福。

translation: In Chinese history, the Taoists once attempted to challenge the above three religious figures.
transcript: 那你会发现我们中国也有一个人儿想挑战，也有一个也有一个门派想挑战三大高手，他就是道家。

translation: They found nothing to give now that the “next life” was already promised by others.
transcript: 道家说，你居然连他的来世都超度了。

translation: What could they do?
transcript: 那我怎么办呢？

translation: They chose to eternalize “this life”.
transcript: 因为有没有来世不好证明，所以我索性就让你不死，对吧。

translation: So they began to make “pills of immortality” with alchemistic materials.
transcript: 于是他们开始练仙丹。

translation: Later, with their “pills” proving to be ineffective, their impact was weakened.
transcript: 但是后来发现吹过头了，所以影响力就弱了。

translation: The topic today is how we can impress and influence others.
transcript: 今天我们讲的主题呢，一个人怎么才能影响人。

translation: We conclude that we can influence others by “giving”.
transcript: 那么我们会发现影响别人的方法是给予。

translation: What should we give?
transcript: 给予什么呢？

translation: Benefit, respect and approach.
transcript: 给予利，给予名，给予法这三个东西。

translation: What has been advocated most in recent years?
transcript: 那么，这二年我们最崇拜的是什么呢？

translation: Not IQ, but EQ.
transcript: 不是智商，而是情商。

translation: What’s the core of EQ?
transcript: 情商的核心是什么呢？

translation: It is an ability to control your desire and emotion and to relate to other people.
transcript: 控制自己的欲望，控制自己的情绪，再跟别人拉近距离。

translation: So this “control” is about two aspects, receiving and giving.
transcript: 讲的是两方面，第一是先控制要，第二是先要给。

translation: That’s why we consider high EQ a must for leadership.
transcript: 所以我们说情商高的人能做领导。

translation: How can you impress and influence others, approach others, unite others and convince others? Have you ever thought about it?
transcript: 你想过没有一个人怎么才能影响别人，怎么才能笼络人，怎么才能团结人，使别人服你。

translation: With what you can convince them?
transcript: 服什么呢？

translation: It’s all about giving.
transcript: 就是你先给了。

translation: So grass-roots employees should get paid before the management.
transcript: 所以谁是员工，那就是先拿的，谁是领导，就是后拿的。

translation: Yet, the earlier a payment is made, the smaller it is.
transcript: 但是有个好处先拿的只能拿小的，后拿的就拿大的。

translation: Fair enough, isn’t it?
transcript: 公平吗？

translation: So my dear friend, do you wanna possess larger influence?
transcript: 所以朋友，你想拥有更大的影响力吗？

translation: When you need anything but money, please give some money to those who are in dire need.
transcript: 如果你连穷得来只剩下钱，请你给予更多给那些需要帮助的人。

translation: If you have nothing to give, not even the money, you can still give them your smile, a nod of greeting and compliment.
transcript: 如果你连钱什么都没有了，至少你还有微笑、点头和赞美。

translation: If you can’t even give your smile, a nod of greeting and compliment, you can still contribute your thinking and body.
transcript: 如果连微笑、点头和赞美都再也没有力气做的时候，我们还有思想和肉体留给人间。

translation: Thanks!
transcript: 谢谢！
